question.title: Will the European Commission’s AI Office publish a revised draft (a new version) of the general-purpose AI (GPAI) code of practice?
question.description:
A revised draft would indicate active iteration in the EU’s GPAI governance toolkit and can affect near-term compliance planning for frontier model providers.

`{"format":"bot_tournament_question","info":{"hash_id":"1f6a4078a8294709","sheet_id":180.0}}`
question.resolution_criteria: This question resolves “Yes” if, after the time the question opens and before May 1, 2026, an official EU AI Office / European Commission page publishes a draft document explicitly labeled as a draft or consultation draft of a revised/new version of the GPAI code of practice, and “No” otherwise. The primary source is the European Commission’s “Drawing-up a General-Purpose AI Code of Practice” policy page: https://digital-strategy.ec.europa.eu/en/policies/ai-code-practice A qualifying publication must make the draft text available (e.g., as a downloadable file or embedded text) and must be clearly a new draft version released after the question opens.
question.fine_print: Do not count announcements that a draft will be published later unless the draft text itself is published. Do not count minor webpage edits that do not publish a draft document. If multiple draft versions are published after opening, any one is sufficient to resolve “Yes.” If the primary page is unavailable, resolve using the European Commission’s GPAI code landing page and related AI Office library items. Candidate Sources include https://digital-strategy.ec.europa.eu/en/policies/contents-code-gpai and https://digital-strategy.ec.europa.eu/en/policies/artificial-intelligence. If disputes arise about whether a document is an “official draft,” require publication on an official EU domain; otherwise apply the Metaculus credible-sources policy at https://www.metaculus.com/faq/.
